title: Elijah Daniel urges fans to fire Piers Morgan after GMB poll backfires
text:
The pair don’t see eye to eye (Pictures: YouTube/REX/ITV)

Eiljah Daniel has urged his fanbase to ‘fire Piers Morgan’ after a Good Morning Britain poll, which asked if he should be removed, appears to have backfired in a big way.

After a petition called for the presenter’s removal, the show’s official Twitter account put it to a vote. At the time of writing, 57% have voted for Piers to be removed.

YouTube star Elijah, who previously bought a Michigan town and renamed it ‘Gay Hell’ to protest against the Trump administration, has been urging his followers to take action against him.

The YouTube star is urging his viewers to take action (Picture: Twitter)

Quoting the poll on Twitter, he wrote: ‘LMAOOOOO THEY RLY PUT HIS JOB UP TO A TWITTER POLL HELPPPPP YALL KNOW WHAT TO DO HIT THAT FIRE HIS A** BUTTON.’

He went on to add: ‘Good luck on the poll deciding ur job @piersmorgan,’ before saying: ‘piers morgan on live tv finding out that we took over the poll to fire him is…..truly beautiful.’

‘The sadness in ur eyes fuels me @piersmorgan,’ he then declared.

Piers has addressed the poll on the ITV show, saying: ‘When I left the building yesterday, the poll was 80% solidly I should stay. We had about 60-70,000 votes.

‘It’s now been hijacked by these snowflake websites and Twitter handles, so all last night they were like, “We’ve got to get rid of him, get rid of him!”, they actually think they can get rid of me.’

He continued: ‘We’ve now had over 300,000 votes, one of the biggest in the history of the show, and it’s now moved 59% against me, now viewers, you’re not the snowflake brigade, you are my people.

‘You are my army, I need you to get busy this morning. We cannot let the snowflakes win.’

The poll appears to have backfired (Picture: Twitter)

Following the original petition, Piers also hit back at claims, insisting he’s not transphobic.

‘It is an extremely difficult, emotional, psychological process. I’ve taken the position that if we suddenly start saying there is a hundred genders it does the people who have transitioned a grave disservice,’ he said.

‘It makes them look pointless, like why are they bothering, and I have been consistent on that position,’ he continued.

‘I think most people including most trans people think a hundred genders, or the concept of a hundred genders, is ridiculous.’
